songs.title: Scars and Smoke
songs.lyrics:
Verse 1
Sunrise bleeds red over coal-dust hills, another day’s begun,
Gravel crunches under boots, chasin’ a merciless sun.
Ain’t the life I dreamed, boy, ain’t the hand I aimed to draw,
But ghosts of broken yesterdays still claw me raw.
Pre-Chorus
No preacher’s words could save me, no bottle drowns the pain,
Just me and these old scars, walkin’ through the rain.
Chorus
Scars and smoke, heart carved to stone, that’s all they think I am,
A rambler’s soul, bound to roam, with a rebel’s give-a-damn.
But deep beneath this busted shell, a spark still fights to burn,
Scratchin’ through the gates of hell, for peace I’ll never earn.
Verse 2
Highway’s a lonesome thread, gray as a miner’s grave,
Each mile a cut that memory’s blade never forgave.
Burned my bridges, paid in blood, for choices I can’t mend,
Huntin’ grace in ghost-town dust, where the lost roads end.
Pre-Chorus
No mercy in the mirror, just a boy who learned to fight,
Carvin’ truth from shattered years, under cold starlight.
Chorus
Scars and smoke, heart carved to stone, that’s all they think I am,
A rambler’s soul, bound to roam, with a rebel’s give-a-damn.
But deep beneath this busted shell, a spark still fights to burn,
Scratchin’ through the gates of hell, for peace I’ll never earn.
Bridge
They say time stitches wounds, but mine still bleed and scream,
Echoes of a daddy’s fist haunt every damn dream.
I won’t let the dark win, won’t lay down and die,
Gonna claw toward that faint light, till I touch the sky.
Chorus
Scars and smoke, heart carved to stone, that’s all they think I am,
A rambler’s soul, bound to roam, with a rebel’s give-a-damn.
But deep beneath this busted shell, a spark still fights to burn,
Scratchin’ through the gates of hell, for peace I’ll never earn.
Outro
*(Slow picking, low E drone)*
Just a flicker of peace tonight, under this lonesome moon so bright.
Scars and smoke, it’s all I’ve known,
Keep walkin’ these roads, till I call ‘em home.

## 38. The Reveal

**Updated:** 5/26/2025

songs.title: Wildflower Heart
songs.lyrics:
Title:  Wildflower Heart
(Verse 1)
Grandma's china, chipped and worn
Sitting pretty on a shelf, a life adorned
With stories whispered, dreams untold
A legacy of strength, a heart of gold
But I wasn't born for porcelain and lace
This restless spirit needed open space
To find my own voice, my own design
A different kind of beauty, a wilder vine
(Chorus)
I'm a wildflower heart, blooming late
Reaching for the sun, defying fate
Breaking free from fences, painted white
Dancing in the moonlight, bathed in silver light
I'm a wildflower heart, finally free
This untamed spirit, that's the real me
(Verse 2)
Mama's wisdom, etched in lines
On her hands that worked, through sun and shine
She taught me kindness, grace, and how to pray
But sometimes silence stole my words away
I traded whispers for a roaring sound
My roots ran deeper in unturned ground
Where shadows danced and secrets grew
And I discovered truths, mama never knew
(Bridge)
Maybe it's the wind that carries seeds of change
Across the generations, rearranging
The patterns of our lives, the paths we roam
Until we finally find our way back home
To the heart that beats within, wild and strong
Where we belong, where we've belonged all along
(Chorus)
I'm a wildflower heart, blooming late
Reaching for the sun, defying fate
Breaking free from fences, painted white
Dancing in the moonlight, bathed in silver light
I'm a wildflower heart, finally free
This untamed spirit, that's the real me
(Outro)
Yeah, this wildflower heart, it's finally free
Blooming bright, for everyone to see
This untamed spirit, that's the real me
The real me.

songs.soundsLike: A traditional country ballad with a touch of folk, "Wildflower Heart" features soulful vocals reminiscent of Reba McIntyre. Heartfelt delivery tells a story of independence and self-discovery, echoing classic country themes of longing and resilience over a production style that honors the genre's rich history.

songs.title: Profile
songs.lyrics:
Name: Alex Wilson
Age: 19 (Born: July 12, 2005)
Instruments: Guitar, Fiddle, Voice, Piano (all self-taught — he's never touched a real piano, only imagines the keys in his mind)
Favorite musicians: Johnny Cash, Waylon Jennings, Chris Stapleton, Tyler Childers, Adele
Favorite songs: "Hurt" by Johnny Cash, "Cover Me Up" by Jason Isbell, "O Death" (as sung by Ralph Stanley)
Height: 6ft 2
Hometown: Pikeville, Kentucky
Most Influential Album: "Traveller" by Chris Stapleton
Dream Collaborations: Dolly Parton, Reba McEntire, Tyler Childers
Signature Look: Often shirtless, in worn Wrangler jeans and sun-faded white tees that cling to his frame, finished with scuffed leather boots that have walked miles of hard road
Favorite item of clothing: A pair of worn Wranglers that he's had through the fields, the mines, heartbreak and pain. Describes them as "feeling like home".
Hidden Talent: Can fix and restore broken instruments
Biggest Fear: Repeating his father's mistakes
Favourite Place to Write: Sitting on the tailgate of his truck, parked where the pines thin out and the mountain wind whistles
Worst Injury: Broken arm at 14 when his father went too far — the injury never healed quite right, but he still taught himself to play through the pain
Most Treasured Possession: The rusted guitar he found at six — still plays it on every track
View on Fame: "I ain't chasin' fame — just truth. If folks feel what I felt when I wrote it, that’s enough."
Biography
At nineteen, I wear my scars like armour and my past like a shadow—always close, always shaping who I am. My body's been forged by labour and hardship: broad shoulders that taper into a lean, muscular frame, each sinew a testament to the life I've lived. My sun-bronzed skin bears the imprint of too many harsh summers, while calloused hands tell silent stories of work, pain, and persistence.
My face turns heads—often twice. A sharply chiselled jawline seems etched from stone, paired with striking steel-blue eyes that shift from icy calm to turbulent oceans depending on my mood. My dark, tousled hair falls effortlessly into place, a rare ease in an otherwise relentless existence. Most days, worn denim and plain white tees cling tight to my chest, hiding beneath simplicity the immense weight of unseen burdens. I walk like someone braced for impact, reflexes primed by a childhood spent dodging fists and insults. My rare smiles hold a quiet defiance, as if daring the world to rob me of one more thing.
I grew up hidden away in a battered double-wide trailer, rusting silently at the forgotten end of Blackberry Creek Road near Pikeville, Kentucky—coal country. Our home was a steel cage of broken glass and whispered secrets, resting precariously on cinder blocks amid scrubby pines and mountains that watched in silent judgment. Inside, silence was currency, and I learned early how precious words could be.
Behind those splintered walls, music became my salvation. At six years old, I rescued a cracked and rusted guitar from a roadside dump, smuggling it home beneath my jacket to hide beneath loose floorboards. It became my companion in darkness, strings vibrating with unspoken truths, each note another breath in suffocating silence. When my father passed out, alcohol-soaked and oblivious, I’d coax melodies from beneath battered wood, fingertips raw and bleeding. Music was my only rebellion, my secret strength.
By the time I was nine, I was working. Daddy stayed passed out most mornings, and if I wanted food or a way to get to school, I had to earn it. This was poor country—nobody looked twice. I bussed tables, picked crops, washed trailers, anything I could do to keep the lights on. I've always worked. I raised myself, scraped my knees and stitched my pride. Like the song I wrote later put it:
No lullabies, no 'good job, son' —
Just the sound of doors slammin’ when the hard times come.
That’s not just a lyric. That’s the sound my childhood made.
My musical talent isn't learned—it's lived. Complete songs form vividly in my mind, spilling out fully formed, raw and powerful as storms rolling down the Appalachians. I chase melodies blindly, hands driven by an urgency to release whatever's trapped inside me. It isn't talent as much as it is survival, the lifeline thrown into my solitary ocean of despair. One chorus, more than any other, rides that edge:
Heard a whisper in the wreckage, ‘neath the coffee grounds and rust, A broken Hallelujah risin’ from the dust.
That line comes from a song I wrote about the day I found my first guitar in a dumpster. I didn't find an instrument — I found a voice.
Yet lyrics still spill onto the page, sometimes without melodies to anchor them. Some lines feel like they've always lived in my blood — I carry them through the day like breath. One verse has haunted me since the first time it came to me, just after a particularly long shift down in the mine:
Coal dust in my lungs, blood on the floor,
Dad’s fists kept time with the slam of the door.
I didn’t write it — I survived it. That line, that rhythm, it just arrived, fully formed. Songs emerge from the shadows of the mountains, echoing the silent ache within me. of the mountains, echoing the silent ache within me. The hardest one, scribbled in the shaky handwriting of a seven-year-old, is titled simply "Mommy, Make Him Stop"—a desperate prayer whispered to the mother I never knew, pleading into emptiness for rescue that never came.
Every instrument I touched became an ally. Invisible piano keys danced under my fingertips on kitchen tables, their silent melodies my first real taste of hope. An abandoned violin, salvaged from a roadside dumpster, sang beneath my touch, its broken strings transforming sorrow into something achingly beautiful. Instruments became weapons—each note a shield, each song a battle won against my past.
My mother's death at childbirth was my father’s endless ammunition. He wielded guilt like a blade, words sharper than his fists, reminding me constantly of the love I'd supposedly stolen. Welts from his belt marked my skin, but deeper wounds silenced my voice, smothering melodies before they could escape. Yet somehow, beneath bruises and scars, my voice endured—deep and resonant, rugged as mountain rock, touched by gravelly tones reminiscent of Chris Stapleton, Johnny Cash's quiet gravity, and the fiery grit of Travis Tritt. But no one has heard it. I’ve never played a gig, never stood before a mic. My songs are mine alone, scribbled into margins and murmured into silence. Each note carries pain, honesty, and defiance.
At sixteen, a fist marked my birthday and eviction notice simultaneously. Cast out with nothing but my instruments and unbroken spirit, I found shelter in another cramped trailer down the road, rented from Mr Jones—barely a home, yet entirely mine. Work was constant: fields, farms, and eventually mines, hands bloodied, knees raw, lungs filled with coal dust. Each dollar earned was another stitch holding my fragmented dreams together.
I built muscle over trauma, seeking strength as armour against vulnerability. Yet, despite relentless hours in fields and mines, the music persisted—trapped, aching, whispering incessantly from within. That battered guitar, once hidden beneath my childhood fears, now travels openly by my side. It remains my shield, my sword, my deepest truth.
Someday soon, I'll summon the courage to let these buried songs free, tearing down the walls I've spent a lifetime constructing. And when that moment comes, the world won’t just hear my music—they'll feel it, raw and powerful, echoing from holler to mountaintop, a voice finally breaking free from silence.
songs.rawContent:
## 40. Profile

**Created:** 5/26/2025
**Updated:** 5/26/2025

### Lyrics

Name: Alex Wilson
Age: 19 (Born: July 12, 2005)
Instruments: Guitar, Fiddle, Voice, Piano (all self-taught — he's never touched a real piano, only imagines the keys in his mind)
Favorite musicians: Johnny Cash, Waylon Jennings, Chris Stapleton, Tyler Childers, Adele
Favorite songs: "Hurt" by Johnny Cash, "Cover Me Up" by Jason Isbell, "O Death" (as sung by Ralph Stanley)
Height: 6ft 2
Hometown: Pikeville, Kentucky
Most Influential Album: "Traveller" by Chris Stapleton
Dream Collaborations: Dolly Parton, Reba McEntire, Tyler Childers
Signature Look: Often shirtless, in worn Wrangler jeans and sun-faded white tees that cling to his frame, finished with scuffed leather boots that have walked miles of hard road
Favorite item of clothing: A pair of worn Wranglers that he's had through the fields, the mines, heartbreak and pain. Describes them as "feeling like home".
Hidden Talent: Can fix and restore broken instruments
Biggest Fear: Repeating his father's mistakes
Favourite Place to Write: Sitting on the tailgate of his truck, parked where the pines thin out and the mountain wind whistles
Worst Injury: Broken arm at 14 when his father went too far — the injury never healed quite right, but he still taught himself to play through the pain
Most Treasured Possession: The rusted guitar he found at six — still plays it on every track
View on Fame: "I ain't chasin' fame — just truth. If folks feel what I felt when I wrote it, that’s enough."
Biography
At nineteen, I wear my scars like armour and my past like a shadow—always close, always shaping who I am. My body's been forged by labour and hardship: broad shoulders that taper into a lean, muscular frame, each sinew a testament to the life I've lived. My sun-bronzed skin bears the imprint of too many harsh summers, while calloused hands tell silent stories of work, pain, and persistence.
My face turns heads—often twice. A sharply chiselled jawline seems etched from stone, paired with striking steel-blue eyes that shift from icy calm to turbulent oceans depending on my mood. My dark, tousled hair falls effortlessly into place, a rare ease in an otherwise relentless existence. Most days, worn denim and plain white tees cling tight to my chest, hiding beneath simplicity the immense weight of unseen burdens. I walk like someone braced for impact, reflexes primed by a childhood spent dodging fists and insults. My rare smiles hold a quiet defiance, as if daring the world to rob me of one more thing.
I grew up hidden away in a battered double-wide trailer, rusting silently at the forgotten end of Blackberry Creek Road near Pikeville, Kentucky—coal country. Our home was a steel cage of broken glass and whispered secrets, resting precariously on cinder blocks amid scrubby pines and mountains that watched in silent judgment. Inside, silence was currency, and I learned early how precious words could be.
Behind those splintered walls, music became my salvation. At six years old, I rescued a cracked and rusted guitar from a roadside dump, smuggling it home beneath my jacket to hide beneath loose floorboards. It became my companion in darkness, strings vibrating with unspoken truths, each note another breath in suffocating silence. When my father passed out, alcohol-soaked and oblivious, I’d coax melodies from beneath battered wood, fingertips raw and bleeding. Music was my only rebellion, my secret strength.
By the time I was nine, I was working. Daddy stayed passed out most mornings, and if I wanted food or a way to get to school, I had to earn it. This was poor country—nobody looked twice. I bussed tables, picked crops, washed trailers, anything I could do to keep the lights on. I've always worked. I raised myself, scraped my knees and stitched my pride. Like the song I wrote later put it:
No lullabies, no 'good job, son' —
Just the sound of doors slammin’ when the hard times come.
That’s not just a lyric. That’s the sound my childhood made.
My musical talent isn't learned—it's lived. Complete songs form vividly in my mind, spilling out fully formed, raw and powerful as storms rolling down the Appalachians. I chase melodies blindly, hands driven by an urgency to release whatever's trapped inside me. It isn't talent as much as it is survival, the lifeline thrown into my solitary ocean of despair. One chorus, more than any other, rides that edge:
Heard a whisper in the wreckage, ‘neath the coffee grounds and rust, A broken Hallelujah risin’ from the dust.
That line comes from a song I wrote about the day I found my first guitar in a dumpster. I didn't find an instrument — I found a voice.
Yet lyrics still spill onto the page, sometimes without melodies to anchor them. Some lines feel like they've always lived in my blood — I carry them through the day like breath. One verse has haunted me since the first time it came to me, just after a particularly long shift down in the mine:
Coal dust in my lungs, blood on the floor,
Dad’s fists kept time with the slam of the door.
I didn’t write it — I survived it. That line, that rhythm, it just arrived, fully formed. Songs emerge from the shadows of the mountains, echoing the silent ache within me. of the mountains, echoing the silent ache within me. The hardest one, scribbled in the shaky handwriting of a seven-year-old, is titled simply "Mommy, Make Him Stop"—a desperate prayer whispered to the mother I never knew, pleading into emptiness for rescue that never came.
Every instrument I touched became an ally. Invisible piano keys danced under my fingertips on kitchen tables, their silent melodies my first real taste of hope. An abandoned violin, salvaged from a roadside dumpster, sang beneath my touch, its broken strings transforming sorrow into something achingly beautiful. Instruments became weapons—each note a shield, each song a battle won against my past.
My mother's death at childbirth was my father’s endless ammunition. He wielded guilt like a blade, words sharper than his fists, reminding me constantly of the love I'd supposedly stolen. Welts from his belt marked my skin, but deeper wounds silenced my voice, smothering melodies before they could escape. Yet somehow, beneath bruises and scars, my voice endured—deep and resonant, rugged as mountain rock, touched by gravelly tones reminiscent of Chris Stapleton, Johnny Cash's quiet gravity, and the fiery grit of Travis Tritt. But no one has heard it. I’ve never played a gig, never stood before a mic. My songs are mine alone, scribbled into margins and murmured into silence. Each note carries pain, honesty, and defiance.
At sixteen, a fist marked my birthday and eviction notice simultaneously. Cast out with nothing but my instruments and unbroken spirit, I found shelter in another cramped trailer down the road, rented from Mr Jones—barely a home, yet entirely mine. Work was constant: fields, farms, and eventually mines, hands bloodied, knees raw, lungs filled with coal dust. Each dollar earned was another stitch holding my fragmented dreams together.
I built muscle over trauma, seeking strength as armour against vulnerability. Yet, despite relentless hours in fields and mines, the music persisted—trapped, aching, whispering incessantly from within. That battered guitar, once hidden beneath my childhood fears, now travels openly by my side. It remains my shield, my sword, my deepest truth.
Someday soon, I'll summon the courage to let these buried songs free, tearing down the walls I've spent a lifetime constructing. And when that moment comes, the world won’t just hear my music—they'll feel it, raw and powerful, echoing from holler to mountaintop, a voice finally breaking free from silence.

songs.title: Whiskey Prayers
songs.lyrics:
Whiskey Prayers
(Verse 1)
The clock on the wall whispers three AM
Another night swallowed by the flickering flame
Of a dying fire, and a burning regret
For words I ain’t spoken, and truths I ain’t met.
This bottle, my confidant, listens so well
To the secrets I keep, the stories I tell
Of a love gone astray, a dream left behind
And the ghost of your laughter that haunts my mind.
(Chorus)
Bottle by bottle, prayer by prayer,
I talk to a God I’m not sure is there.
Forgive me my sins, forgive me my fears —
And hear my whiskey prayers.
(Verse 2)
The ice in my glass clinks a mournful tune
A soundtrack of sorrow beneath the pale moon
I pour out my heart, in this dimly lit room
Hoping for solace, escaping the gloom.
I confess my transgressions, the promises broken
The bridges I burned, the words left unspoken.
I beg for redemption, a chance to rewind
To a time before heartbreak, when love wasn't blind.
(Chorus)
Bottle by bottle, prayer by prayer,
I talk to a God I’m not sure is there.
Forgive me my sins, forgive me my fears —
And hear my whiskey prayers.
(Bridge)
Maybe these whispers, lost in the night
Are just the ramblings of a soul taking flight
Into the darkness, searching for light
A desperate plea in the fading moonlight.
But even if silence is all that I find
A small sliver of hope still lingers behind
That somewhere, somehow, someone understands
These fragile confessions from trembling hands.
(Chorus)
Bottle by bottle, prayer by prayer,
I talk to a God I’m not sure is there.
Forgive me my sins, forgive me my fears —
And hear my whiskey prayers.
(Outro)
Whiskey prayers, rising like smoke
Words unspoken, a heart that’s broke.
Whiskey prayers, lost in the air
A silent confession, nobody there.
Except the bottle, and the lonely chair.
And the ghost of your laughter, everywhere.

songs.title: Grace for the Broken
songs.lyrics:
Grace for the Broken
(Verse 1)
Granddaddy's ghost still walks these halls
A shadow cast on these crumbling walls
Anger simmered, a pot left to boil
Passed down the line, poisoning the soil
Mama tried to mend the fractured ground
But the seeds of hurt took root profound
We learned to fight, to bite, to claw
Survival mode became our only law
(Chorus)
For the fists that never learned to fold
For the hearts stitched from pieces of old
There’s a table set and a seat wide open
There’s grace for the broken, yeah, grace for the broken
(Verse 2)
I see it now in my children's eyes
That flicker of fear they try to disguise
The legacy of pain, a heavy chain
Binding us together in this weary refrain
But I'm breaking free, I'm cutting the ties
Trading the shadows for open skies
Learning to forgive, to heal, to grow
Planting seeds of hope where the weeds used to flow
(Bridge)
This ain’t a curse we're destined to bear
This ain't a burden we're forced to share
We can rewrite the story, turn the page
Break the cycle, escape the cage
(Chorus)
For the fists that never learned to fold
For the hearts stitched from pieces of old
There’s a table set and a seat wide open
There’s grace for the broken, yeah, grace for the broken
(Outro)
There's grace enough, there's love enough to mend
The broken branches, make them whole again
Grace for the broken, grace for the broken
A new generation, a new story spoken.
Grace for the broken.

songs.title: After Midnight Promises
songs.lyrics:
After Midnight Promises
(Verse 1)
Tail lights bleedin' into the black
Gravel road hummin' beneath the Cadillac
Radio whispers a forgotten tune
Out here in the dark, bathed in the moon
Got nowhere to be, nowhere to run
Just the echo of your laughter, spun
Into the fabric of this stolen night
Holding on tight, burning ever so bright
(Chorus)
In the hush before the dawn breaks us apart
You trace promises across my heart
No witnesses, just breath and sin
After midnight, we begin again
With tangled limbs and whispered words
Like secrets shared by restless birds
This back road haven, our sacred space
After midnight, we find our grace
(Verse 2)
The scent of honeysuckle hangs heavy and sweet
Mixing with the dust beneath our feet
This old dirt road, a familiar friend
Leading us to where our journeys bend
And intertwine like branches in the breeze
Finding solace in the rustling leaves
The world outside can fade away
In this hidden moment, we choose to stay
(Bridge)
Maybe it’s wrong, this clandestine affair
Stealing moments, breathing borrowed air
But the fire in your eyes, the touch of your hand
Makes this forbidden feeling, grand
I know we’ll part when morning light appears
But these stolen hours will chase away my fears
(Chorus)
In the hush before the dawn breaks us apart
You trace promises across my heart
No witnesses, just breath and sin
After midnight, we begin again
With tangled limbs and whispered words
Like secrets shared by restless birds
This back road haven, our sacred space
After midnight, we find our grace
(Outro)
After midnight, we find our grace
Yeah, after midnight, we find our place
Just you and me, until the break of day
After midnight, we begin again, come what may.

songs.title: Phoenix Flight
songs.lyrics:
Title:  Phoenix Flight
(Verse 1)
Dust devils danced on the cracked, dry land
Reflection stared back, a ghost in my hand
Thought I was buried, six feet beneath the shame
Rattlesnake whisperin',  "Ain't nobody else to blame."
Sun beatin' down, a crucible of pain
But something shifted, a low rumble in the rain.
(Chorus)
These ashes ain't my ending, they're the fuel for the flame
Burnin' off the past, risin' up with a new name
No more lookin' backward, no more chains to hold me down
This ain't a resurrection, this is a phoenix flight outta this town.
(Verse 2)
Built my own pyre with the regrets I'd held tight
Every broken promise, bathed in the fading light
The whispers turned to roars, the demons screamed and cried
As the flames licked higher, I felt the fear subside.
Let the judgment fall, let the gossipers spin their lies
'Cause the only truth that matters is the fire in my eyes.
(Chorus)
These ashes ain't my ending, they're the fuel for the flame
Burnin' off the past, risin' up with a new name
No more lookin' backward, no more chains to hold me down
This ain't a resurrection, this is a phoenix flight outta this town.
(Bridge)
They thought they had me broken, thought I'd wither and fade
But they underestimated the wildfire I had made
From the embers of heartbreak, a fierce spirit takes flight
Soaring through the darkness, bathed in the morning light.
(Chorus)
These ashes ain't my ending, they're the fuel for the flame
Burnin' off the past, risin' up with a new name
No more lookin' backward, no more chains to hold me down
This ain't a resurrection, this is a phoenix flight outta this town.
(Outro)
Yeah, a phoenix flight, a phoenix flight
Outta this town, into the light.
Flyin' high, leavin' the dust behind
A phoenix flight, peace of mind.

songs.title: Mountain Fire (Raise Up)
songs.lyrics:
Verse 1
In the shadow of the hills where the hard days grind,
Sweat and steel forge a heart that won’t bend or bind.
Pick in hand, boots on stone, through the dust we climb,
Work’s our rhythm, it’s the pulse that keeps us alive.
Pre-Chorus
No storm can break us, no dark can hold,
Strength in our hands, in the fire we mold.
Chorus
Mountain fire, burnin’ fierce, burnin’ proud,
Raise up, shake the earth, let the anthem sound.
From the valleys low to the peaks we climb,
Find your peace in the work, let your spirit shine!
Verse 2
Dawn to dusk, we carve our way through stone,
Every hammer swing’s a vow that we’ll never be owned.
In the toil, in the ache, there’s a truth we find,
Labor’s our freedom, it’s the strength of our kind.
Pre-Chorus
No weight can crush us, no night too long,
We build our peace where the weary grow strong.
Chorus
Mountain fire, burnin’ fierce, burnin’ proud,
Raise up, shake the earth, let the anthem sound.
From the valleys low to the peaks we climb,
Find your peace in the work, let your spirit shine!
Bridge
Feel the ground rumble, hear the workers’ call,
Every strike, every step, we’re unbreaking, we’re tall.
This fire’s our heart, it’s the spark we ignite,
In the sweat of our labor, we’re alive in the fight!
Chorus
Mountain fire, burnin’ fierce, burnin’ proud,
Raise up, shake the earth, let the anthem sound.
From the valleys low to the peaks we climb,
Find your peace in the work, let your spirit shine!
Outro
(Hard stomp, slow picking)
Mountain fire… raise it high… burn forever, touch the sky.

songs.title: Found in the Heartland
songs.lyrics:
Found in the Heartland
(Verse 1)
Heat shimmered on the cracked asphalt road
Cars streamed westward, a heavy load
Of hopes they carried, steel and gasoline
Seeking fortunes, a brighter scene
Than the wheat fields rippling in the breeze
Than the crickets chirping beneath the trees
But I stayed rooted, watched them disappear
'Cause the life they chased never felt so clear
(Chorus)
Found in the heartland, off the beaten track
Slowed my heartbeat, never looked back
While they searched for diamonds, I found the gold
In the simple moments, a story untold
Yeah, found in the heartland, under the sun
Where the river runs deep and the wild horses run
No flashing billboards, no city sky glow
Just the quiet rhythm of a life I know
(Verse 2)
They called me restless, said I lacked direction
Wandering aimlessly, lacking connection
But the city's clamor never stirred my soul
Its crowded streets felt like a losing roll
I found solace in the open sky
In the eagle's sharp cry, way up high
In the river's current, cool and slow
In the simple beauty of the afterglow
(Bridge)
Maybe someday they'll understand
The quiet power of this land
A life built on presence, steady and strong
A quiet victory, where I belong
(Chorus)
Found in the heartland, off the beaten track
Slowed my heartbeat, never looked back
While they searched for diamonds, I found the gold
In the simple moments, a story untold
Yeah, found in the heartland, under the sun
Where the river runs deep and the wild horses run
No flashing billboards, no city sky glow
Just the quiet rhythm of a life I know
(Outro)
Just the quiet rhythm… the quiet rhythm… of a life I know… in the heartland.

songs.title: Tales from the Heartland
songs.lyrics:
Verse 1
In the heartland’s dust, where the sun don’t quit,
Calloused hands carve dreams from the gravel and grit.
Miners swing picks ‘neath the Kentucky clay,
Farmers sow hope through the long, hard day.
Pre-Chorus
Sweat on their brows, fire in their soul,
Buildin’ a life where the heartland rolls.
Chorus
Tales from the heartland, sing ‘em loud, sing ‘em proud,
Workers risin’ up, shakin’ earth with the sound!
From the coal-dark depths to the fields of green,
These are the stories of the folks we’ve seen!
Verse 2
Factory lines hum where the midnight oil burns,
Truckers haul heavy while the big wheels turn.
Waitresses smile through the ache in their feet,
Every small-town heart keeps the rhythm sweet.
Pre-Chorus
Blood in their veins, fight in their core,
Carvin’ out futures where the heartland soars.
Chorus
Tales from the heartland, sing ‘em loud, sing ‘em proud,
Workers risin’ up, shakin’ earth with the sound!
From the coal-dark depths to the fields of green,
These are the stories of the folks we’ve seen!
Bridge
Raise a glass to the hands that build, to the hearts that bleed,
To the mamas and daddies plantin’ every seed.
In the hollers and plains, their voices unite,
Singin’ tales of the heartland, burnin’ bright tonight!
Chorus
Tales from the heartland, sing ‘em loud, sing ‘em proud,
Workers risin’ up, shakin’ earth with the sound!
From the coal-dark depths to the fields of green,
These are the stories of the folks we’ve seen!
Outro
(Fiddle flourish, hard stomps)
Tales from the heartland, let ‘em ring, let ‘em fly,
Workin’ folks forever, holdin’ up the sky!

songs.title: Mountain’s Dawn
songs.lyrics:
Verse 1
The mountain stayed, but I had to run,
Coal dust trails chasin’ dreams in the sun.
Her smile lit the holler, showed me I could soar,
Gave me wings to fly through a slammed-shut door.
Pre-Chorus
No chain could bind me, no scar could dim,
Her spark’s the fire that’s blazin’ within.
Chorus
The mountain’s dawn is callin’, and I’m risin’ to its glow,
Holdin’ tight to hope she helped my heart to know.
Every song’s a promise, every mile a brand-new start,
Singin’ for the light she gave, it’s healin’ up my heart.
Verse 2
Pikeville’s shadows fade in the rearview’s haze,
Highway hums a hymn of brighter days.
From a rusted guitar to a stage that shines,
I’m weavin’ her belief into these songs of mine.
Pre-Chorus
No night’s too heavy, no road too long,
Her faith’s the fuel that keeps me strong.
Chorus
The mountain’s dawn is callin’, and I’m risin’ to its glow,
Holdin’ tight to hope she helped my heart to know.
Every song’s a promise, every mile a brand-new start,
Singin’ for the light she gave, it’s healin’ up my heart.
Bridge
She bandaged my soul when the world cut deep,
Planted dreams in a boy too bruised to sleep.
Now I’m runnin’ toward the sunrise, with a voice that won’t stay still,
Carryin’ her hope to every heart, from holler to the hill.
Chorus
The mountain’s dawn is callin’, and I’m risin’ to its glow,
Holdin’ tight to hope she helped my heart to know.
Every song’s a promise, every mile a brand-new start,
Singin’ for the light she gave, it’s healin’ up my heart.
Outro
*(Bright fiddle lift, steady picking)*
Mountain’s dawn keeps shinin’, and I’m never lookin’ back,
Her hope’s my guiding star, lightin’ up the track.

songs.title: Lightning in a Bottle
songs.lyrics:
Lightning in a Bottle
(Verse 1)
Barefoot on the porch swing, fireflies in the pines
Mama's sweet tea brewing, daddy humming honky-tonk lines
Didn't know it then, but time was standing still
Just a whisper of forever, on that Georgia hill
(Verse 2)
Sneakin' out to the river, first taste of cheap wine
Radio hummin' low, beneath the moonlight shine
Your hand in mine, a spark ignites the flame
Didn't know it then, but nothin' would be the same
(Chorus)
First kiss, first laugh, first wrong turn made
Every scar and lesson learned, a price gladly paid
Heaven spilled over, in a Mason jar full throttle
We caught lightning in a bottle
(Verse 3)
Years flew by like tumbleweeds across a dusty plain
Through sunshine and through heartache, the love remained
Built a life together, brick by weathered brick
Every crack and imperfection, a love that will not stick
(Verse 4)
Now the grandkids are runnin' wild, just like we used to do
Fireflies still dancin', sky a brilliant blue
Holding your hand tighter, wrinkles around my eyes
This ain't the end of forever, it's just a new sunrise
(Bridge)
They say time keeps on tickin', and seasons come and go
But the memories we've made, they'll forever glow
Like embers in the darkness, a warm and steady light
Guiding us through the shadows, holding us through the night
(Chorus)
First kiss, first laugh, first wrong turn made
Every scar and lesson learned, a price gladly paid
Heaven spilled over, in a Mason jar full throttle
We caught lightning in a bottle
(Outro)
Yeah, we caught lightning in a bottle
And we'll hold on tight, forever.
Lightning in a bottle.
Our forever.

songs.title: Title:  Phoenix Flight
songs.lyrics:
Title:  Phoenix Flight
(Verse 1)
Dust devils danced on the cracked, dry land
Reflection stared back, a ghost in my hand
Thought I was buried, six feet beneath the shame
Rattlesnake whisperin',  "Ain't nobody else to blame."
Sun beatin' down, a crucible of pain
But something shifted, a low rumble in the rain.
(Chorus)
These ashes ain't my ending, they're the fuel for the flame
Burnin' off the past, risin' up with a new name
No more lookin' backward, no more chains to hold me down
This ain't a resurrection, this is a phoenix flight outta this town.
(Verse 2)
Built my own pyre with the regrets I'd held tight
Every broken promise, bathed in the fading light
The whispers turned to roars, the demons screamed and cried
As the flames licked higher, I felt the fear subside.
Let the judgment fall, let the gossipers spin their lies
'Cause the only truth that matters is the fire in my eyes.
(Chorus)
These ashes ain't my ending, they're the fuel for the flame
Burnin' off the past, risin' up with a new name
No more lookin' backward, no more chains to hold me down
This ain't a resurrection, this is a phoenix flight outta this town.
(Bridge)
They thought they had me broken, thought I'd wither and fade
But they underestimated the wildfire I had made
From the embers of heartbreak, a fierce spirit takes flight
Soaring through the darkness, bathed in the morning light.
(Chorus)
These ashes ain't my ending, they're the fuel for the flame
Burnin' off the past, risin' up with a new name
No more lookin' backward, no more chains to hold me down
This ain't a resurrection, this is a phoenix flight outta this town.
(Outro)
Yeah, a phoenix flight, a phoenix flight
Outta this town, into the light.
Flyin' high, leavin' the dust behind
A phoenix flight, peace of mind.

songs.title: Title:  Digital Bonfire
songs.lyrics:
Title:  Digital Bonfire
(Verse 1)
Phone screen glowin', midnight blue
Thumb scrollin', lookin' for you
Comments flyin', hearts on fire
Feedin' the flame, takin' it higher
This ain't a game, this ain't pretend
This digital bonfire, it never ends
Pourin' my soul out, line by line
Hopin' your heart catches mine
(Chorus)
Burnin' it up, burnin' it bright
Underneath the digital light
Every word a spark, every song a flame
Playin' with fire, callin' your name
This digital bonfire, reachin' for the sky
Let the embers fly, let the feelings ride high
(Verse 2)
Strumming my guitar, singin' my truth
Spillin' the secrets of my restless youth
Layin' it bare for the world to see
Hopin' you're watchin', hopin' you're with me
This concrete jungle, a lonely place
But in this moment, I find my grace
Connectin' with souls, across the miles
Tradin' our stories, sharin' our smiles
(Bridge)
They say it's fake, they say it's a show
But the heat I feel, down deep I know
It's real as the tears I cry in the night
Real as the dreams that take flight
This digital world, it ain't all bad
It's where I found the love I never had
(Chorus)
Burnin' it up, burnin' it bright
Underneath the digital light
Every word a spark, every song a flame
Playin' with fire, callin' your name
This digital bonfire, reachin' for the sky
Let the embers fly, let the feelings ride high
(Outro)
So log on in, gather 'round the screen
Let the digital bonfire burn bright and keen
Yeah, let it burn.

songs.title: Full and Gone
songs.lyrics:
Verse 1
I packed my scars in a beat-up truck, left Pikeville in the dust,
Coal-black memories clingin’ tight, like rust that won’t unrust.
Ain’t no fixin’ what that town broke, no mendin’ what it stole,
But I rolled out with a heart still beatin’, battered but whole.
Pre-Chorus
No tears for that trailer, no love for its chains,
Just a boy’s old ghosts and a man’s new pains.
Chorus
I left this town full, not fixed, but full,
Carried my dreams past the weight of its pull.
With a rusted guitar and a fire inside,
I’m gone from the holler, but I’m still alive.
Verse 2
Blackberry Creek’s where I learned to bleed, where fists taught me to stand,
Found a six-string in a dumpster’s wreck, salvation in my hands.
Every bruise a map of hurt, every street a dead-end lie,
But I’m haulin’ hope down this open road, under a clearer sky.
Pre-Chorus
No preacher could save me, no bottle could drown,
The screams of that double-wide, that ghost-ridden town.
Chorus
I left this town full, not fixed, but full,
Carried my dreams past the weight of its pull.
With a rusted guitar and a fire inside,
I’m gone from the holler, but I’m still alive.
Bridge
I ain’t healed, but I’m heavy with fight,
Her spark lit the way through my darkest night.
From the mines’ cold grip to the stage’s raw glow,
I’m full of the strength that only leavin’ can show.
Chorus
I left this town full, not fixed, but full,
Carried my dreams past the weight of its pull.
With a rusted guitar and a fire inside,
I’m gone from the holler, but I’m still alive.
Outro
*(Slow picking, low E drone)*
Full and gone, with the mountain’s old hum,
Singin’ my truth, till the new day comes.

songs.title: Diner Life
songs.lyrics:
Verse 1
Mae’s Diner glows on a lonesome street, neon hummin’ low,
I was nine, pockets full of change, nowhere else to go.
Biscuits warm as a mother’s love, gravy thick with heart,
Found a home in that vinyl booth, when my world fell apart.
Pre-Chorus
Coffee stains and checkered floors, where the broke could rest,
Mae’s smile stitched my shattered soul, gave my heart a nest.
Chorus
Diner life, where the jukebox wails of heartache and dreams,
Truckers, drifters, lost souls mendin’ seams.
In the clink of forks, the hum of late-night fights,
Mae’s Diner held me close, through the long, hard nights.
Verse 2
Waitress knew my name, slipped me extra fries,
Saw my hurt fade slow, never pried ‘bout my eyes.
Counter held my scribbled hopes, dreams scratched in ink,
From a kid with nothin’ to a man who learned to think.
Pre-Chorus
Grease and grace on every plate, where the weary heal,
Mae’s was more than food—it’s where I learned to feel.
Chorus
Diner life, where the jukebox wails of heartache and dreams,
Truckers, drifters, lost souls mendin’ seams.
In the clink of forks, the hum of late-night fights,
Mae’s Diner held me close, through the long, hard nights.
Bridge
Every dime I scraped, I laid on that counter’s shine,
Bought me biscuits, bought me time, bought a spark divine.
Now I sing for the ones still countin’ change in the glow,
Mae’s Diner’s where the heartland’s stories grow.
Chorus
Diner life, where the jukebox wails of heartache and dreams,
Truckers, drifters, lost souls mendin’ seams.
In the clink of forks, the hum of late-night fights,
Mae’s Diner held me close, through the long, hard nights.
Outro
*(Slow fiddle fade, soft picking)*
Diner life… Mae’s light still burns, callin’ me near,
To the place where I found hope, when hope disappeared.

### Sounds Like

Sounds like Acoustic: Gentle fingerpicked acoustic guitar and fiddle create a warm, nostalgic feel, reminiscent of a quiet diner.  Harmonica adds a touch of bluesy melancholy.

Sounds like Recording: Warm, slightly reverb-drenched production with acoustic guitar, bass, drums, fiddle, and harmonica.  A blend of folk, Americana, and heartland rock styles evokes a sense of both intimacy and wide-open spaces.

songs.title: Title: Blackberry Creek Blues
songs.lyrics:
Title: Blackberry Creek Blues
(Verse 1)
Sun bleeds orange through the pines, 'nother day done broke
Down Blackberry Creek Road, where the silence only spoke
Of broken promises and ghosts that linger in the air
Daddy's shadow on the porch, a weight I couldn't bear.
Sixteen years and a busted arm, a guitar and a suitcase old
Walked away from that hollow, a story yet untold.
(Chorus)
Blackberry Creek Blues, singin' in my soul
A melody of hardship, a story to unfold
Of coal dust and callouses, a heart both tough and worn
Blackberry Creek Blues, the day that I was born.
(Verse 2)
Found a shack down by the river, traded work for bed
Pickin' beans and diggin' coal, a roof above my head
This rusted six-string sings my sorrow, sings my pain
A broken boy from broken mountains, singin' in the rain.
Ain't lookin' for no pity, ain't lookin' for no fame
Just tryin' to find my own damn rhythm in this life's hard game.
(Bridge)
Mama used to hum a hymn, a whisper in the dark
Said, "Boy, find your own damn light, leave your own damn mark."
Her words echo in the hollers, a comfort and a guide
As I wrestle with the demons that I keep locked inside.
(Chorus)
Blackberry Creek Blues, singin' in my soul
A melody of hardship, a story to unfold
Of coal dust and callouses, a heart both tough and worn
Blackberry Creek Blues, the day that I was born.
(Outro)
Yeah, Blackberry Creek Blues, they run deep and strong
Like the roots of these old mountains, where I belong.
Where I belong.

songs.title: Title:  Faded Mountain Truths
songs.lyrics:
Title:  Faded Mountain Truths
(Verse 1)
Faded photographs in a dusty frame
Mama's smilin' face, ain't nothin' changed
'Cept the lines etched deeper, like the cracks on these hills
Years of worry and winters' chills
Daddy's shadow, a storm cloud gray
Hangin' heavy, never went away
Learned my lessons in the holler's shade
Mountain wisdom, hard earned and paid
(Chorus)
These mountains whisper secrets old and true
Tough as the roots that see 'em through
Like the wind that bends the pine so low
Gotta bend, not break, to weather the blow
Faded mountain truths, etched in stone
A legacy of hardship, a heart I call my own
(Verse 2)
Sixteen years, Blackberry Creek Road dust on my boots
Kicked out the door, nothin' but the clothes on my back, and a few faded roots
Found shelter in a tin can shack, leaks when it rained
Worked the fields, the mines, felt the body ache and pain
This broken arm, a constant reminder of his rage
But these calloused hands, they turned a new page
Found solace in the strings of a rusted guitar
Singin' my sorrows, beneath the evenin' star
(Bridge)
He tried to break me, spirit and bone
But the mountain in me wouldn't be overthrown
Like the coal that burns, a fire within
I rose from the ashes, learned to begin
(Chorus)
These mountains whisper secrets old and true
Tough as the roots that see 'em through
Like the wind that bends the pine so low
Gotta bend, not break, to weather the blow
Faded mountain truths, etched in stone
A legacy of hardship, a heart I call my own
(Outro)
Sun's comin' up, paintin' the sky gold
A new day breakin', a story yet untold
And though the shadows linger, I ain't afraid no more
Got faded mountain truths, to guide me to the shore.

songs.title: Drink to the Family
songs.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Dust on my boots from a road gone rough
Chased dreams that broke when the times got tough
Kin turned their backs, left scars on my hide
But I found my crew where the good vibes ride
A shot of Jack burns the pain away
These friends are my home, they’re here to stay
(Chorus)
Raise a shot of Jack to the family that ain’t blood
Toast the ones who lift you from the mud
When the world slams the door, they kick it in tight
These rowdy hearts blaze wild in the night
Here’s to family, true and bold!
(Verse 2)
Worked ‘til my hands cracked, bones wore thin
Felt every loss like a cold, hard sin
Ghosts try to drag me, but I ain’t alone
My posse’s my throne, this tailgate’s our zone
A bottle of Bud, we pass it around
Laugh ‘til we’re dizzy, no hurt to be found
(Verse 3)
Moonlight’s our spotlight, the stars set the stage
Raisin’ hell together, we’re writin’ this page
Fights and hard nights, we’ve weathered the storm
These brothers and sisters, they keep my heart warm
A jar of moonshine, it stings, but it’s sweet
To the kin that I chose, who make life complete
(Bridge)
This old guitar wails a rebel’s tune
Sings of nights lit by a bonfire moon
Here’s to the lost, the wild, the free
The ones who stood tall and drank with me
They’re my fight, my soul, my song
(Chorus)
Raise a shot of Jack to the family that ain’t blood
Toast the ones who lift you from the mud
When the world slams the door, they kick it in tight
These rowdy hearts blaze wild in the night
Here’s to family, true and bold!
(Outro)
Yeah, true and bold, through the highs and the lows
Bottle of Bud, moonshine’s glow
Raise a shot of Jack, let the good times roll

### Sounds Like

Sounds like Acoustic: A raw, full blown party song played on acoustic guitar. Gravelly vocals, evoking a sense of campfire camaraderie and a perfect singalong drinking song.

Sounds like Recording: A driving, anthemic country-rock production with layered electric guitars, drums, bass, and powerful vocals, capturing a feeling of rebellious energy and heartfelt celebration.

songs.title: Mamma Make him Stop
songs.lyrics:
Verse
Daddy’s yellin’ loud, his hands they hurt me so,
I hide under my bed, where the shadows grow.
Bottle’s on the floor, it’s breakin’ up our home,
I’m scared and all alone, wishin’ he’d be gone.
Chorus
Mama, make him stop, please make him go away,
I’m prayin’ through my tears, for a brighter day.
Mama, hear my song, I’m beggin’ you to try,
Make him stop the hurt, so I don’t have to cry.

songs.title: Hell and Hymns
songs.lyrics:
Verse 1
Friday night, under neon’s roar,
Whiskey’s pullin’ hard, settlin’ old scores.
Jukebox wails, hearts hit the floor,
Dancin’ through the haze, chasin’ something more.
Another week of grind, bones worn thin,
Sweat still burns where the work don’t end.
But tonight we’re alive, breakin’ every chain,
‘Til the sunrise lights the sky with flame.
Pre-Chorus
Runnin’ wild, but the soul’s still split,
Torn between the dark and the holy lit.
Chorus
Hell and hymns, we’re caught in the fray,
Whiskey sins, then we kneel to pray.
This heart keeps fightin’, searchin’ for release,
Between the devil’s fire and a savior’s peace.
Hell and hymns, our anthem’s cry,
Saturday’s rebellion, Sunday’s sky.
Risin’ from the ashes ‘neath a lonesome moon,
Lord, redeem these hands, scarred and strewn.
Verse 2
Guitar moans a lonesome plea,
Empty bottle spins, hauntin’ memories.
Found that six-string in a junkyard’s shine,
Strummed my soul where the wild winds whine.
Old man’s shadow still stalks my days,
His bitter words like a hell that stays.
But mama’s prayers, they pull me through,
Whisperin’ hope in the morning dew.
Pre-Chorus
Livin’ rough, but the heart holds strong,
Seekin’ light where the nights are long.
Chorus
Hell and hymns, we’re caught in the fray,
Whiskey sins, then we kneel to pray.
This heart keeps fightin’, searchin’ for release,
Between the devil’s fire and a savior’s peace.
Hell and hymns, our anthem’s cry,
Saturday’s rebellion, Sunday’s sky.
Risin’ from the ashes ‘neath a lonesome moon,
Lord, redeem these hands, scarred and strewn.
Bridge
No preacher’s verse, just a worker’s call,
Coal-dust dreams climbin’ past the fall.
Beggin’ for a spark to break the night,
From the shadows to salvation’s light.
Chorus
Hell and hymns, we’re caught in the fray,
Whiskey sins, then we kneel to pray.
This heart keeps fightin’, searchin’ for release,
Between the devil’s fire and a savior’s peace.
Hell and hymns, our anthem’s cry,
Saturday’s rebellion, Sunday’s sky.
Risin’ from the ashes ‘neath a lonesome moon,
Lord, redeem these hands, scarred and strewn.
Outro
*(Fiddle soar, steady strum)*
Hell and hymns, my soul’s still tried,
But I’m risin’ up where the heart don’t hide.
Amen.

songs.title: When You Can't Be Near Me
songs.lyrics:
(Verse 1) When you can't be near me, please think of me, I'm starin' at the highway, where you used to be. You're gone, my darlin', chasin' some new flame, But my heart's still ramblin', callin' out your name.
(Pre-Chorus) This whiskey's cold, it don't ease the pain, Without you here, I'm half insane.
(Chorus) When you can't be near me, oh, my lonesome soul, Keep me in your rearview, where the heartaches roll. Sing my name like a jukebox, broken, wild, and free, When you can't be near me, please think of me.
(Verse 2) I'm thumbin' through old photos, on this cracked phone screen, Your smile's a ghost now, in this lonesome scene. Got your voice in my head, like a steel guitar's cry, Keeps me holdin' on, beneath this empty sky.
(Pre-Chorus) The barstool's creakin', but it ain't my home, Without your touch, I'm destined to roam.
(Chorus) When you can't be near me, oh, my lonesome soul, Keep me in your rearview, where the heartaches roll. Sing my name like a jukebox, broken, wild, and free, When you can't be near me, please think of me.
(Bridge) So raise a glass, wherever you ride, Send a prayer on the wind, to the lonesome side. We'll cross paths again, down some dusty road, Till then, I'm carryin' this heavy load.
(Chorus) When you can't be near me, oh, my lonesome soul, Keep me in your rearview, where the heartaches roll. Sing my name like a jukebox, broken, wild, and free, When you can't be near me, please think of me.
(Outro) So when you're out there, under neon's glow, I'm still your rebel, in the shadows, you know. Till we're back together, where we're meant to be, When you can't be near me... please think of me. Yeah, think of me. (Oh, my lonesome soul.) Think of me.

songs.title: Whiskey Don't Lie
songs.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
I’m sittin’ at this barstool, with a neon glow,
Pourin’ out my heartache, where the jukebox flows.
The bartender knows me, he don’t ask my name,
Just slides another whiskey, to kill the pain.
(Pre-Chorus)
This dive bar’s my church, where the sinners pray,
Spillin’ out their stories, till the break of day.
(Chorus)
Whiskey don’t lie, it tells it straight,
Burns like the truth, no need to wait!
Raise your glass high, let the heartache fly,
Sing it loud, boys, whiskey don’t lie!
(Verse 2)
The gal I loved, she’s gone, took my ramblin’ heart,
Left me with this bottle, and a brand-new scar.
But this amber fire, it don’t judge my sins,
Just lights up the shadows, where my night begins.
(Pre-Chorus)
The jukebox is wailin’, but it can’t compare,
To the truth in this glass, and the pain we share.
(Chorus)
Whiskey don’t lie, it tells it straight,
Burns like the truth, no need to wait!
Raise your glass high, let the heartache fly,
Sing it loud, boys, whiskey don’t lie!
(Bridge)
So here’s to the lost, and the ones we miss,
To the fights and the nights, sealed with a kiss.
Every drop’s a preacher, every sip’s a song,
Sing it with me, brothers, we’ll howl all night long!
(Chorus)
Whiskey don’t lie, it tells it straight,
Burns like the truth, no need to wait!
Raise your glass high, let the heartache fly,
Sing it loud, boys, whiskey don’t lie!
(Outro)
When the barroom’s empty, and the stars burn low,
I’ll stumble to the highway, with nowhere to go.
But I’ll carry this gospel, till the day I die,
Sing it one more time—whiskey don’t lie!
Yeah, whiskey don’t lie! (Raise ‘em up high!)
Whiskey don’t lie!
Acoustic sound: A stripped-down, raw acoustic arrangement with a steady strumming pattern highlights the song's heartache, while a mournful fiddle weaves in and out, emphasizing the lament. The vocal delivery is gritty and vulnerable, carrying the story's emotional weight with a conversational honesty.
Potential Sound:
Outlaw Country Vibe: The song channels the raw, rebellious spirit of outlaw country with vivid imagery (neon, jukeboxes, barstools) and a narrator who’s both broken and defiant. The whiskey serves as a metaphor for unfiltered truth, tying into the genre’s honesty. Singalong Energy: The repetitive chorus (“Whiskey don’t lie, it tells it straight”) and simple, anthemic hooks are designed for a crowd to shout along, with gang vocals and a bridge that rallies everyone to join in. Modern Touches: References to phones or modern heartbreak are subtle, keeping the focus on timeless barroom camaraderie, but the tone feels relatable for 2025. Performance: Picture this in a sweaty honky-tonk or a modern country musical, with a charismatic frontman leading a raucous band (electric guitar, fiddle, piano, drums). The crowd stomps boots, clinks bottles, and sings the chorus at the top of their lungs.

Acoustic sound: A stripped-down, raw acoustic arrangement with a steady strumming pattern highlights the song's heartache, while a mournful fiddle weaves in and out, emphasizing the lament. The vocal delivery is gritty and vulnerable, carrying the story's emotional weight with a conversational honesty.
Potential Sound:
Outlaw Country Vibe: The song channels the raw, rebellious spirit of outlaw country with vivid imagery (neon, jukeboxes, barstools) and a narrator who’s both broken and defiant. The whiskey serves as a metaphor for unfiltered truth, tying into the genre’s honesty. Singalong Energy: The repetitive chorus (“Whiskey don’t lie, it tells it straight”) and simple, anthemic hooks are designed for a crowd to shout along, with gang vocals and a bridge that rallies everyone to join in. Modern Touches: References to phones or modern heartbreak are subtle, keeping the focus on timeless barroom camaraderie, but the tone feels relatable for 2025. Performance: Picture this in a sweaty honky-tonk or a modern country musical, with a charismatic frontman leading a raucous band (electric guitar, fiddle, piano, drums). The crowd stomps boots, clinks bottles, and sings the chorus at the top of their lungs.

songs.title: Backroad Heart
songs.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Out on County Road 9, where the gravel kicks dust,
We carved our initials in an oak, swore we’d never rust.
Your taillights faded, left me standin’ in the rain,
Now I’m chasin’ your memory, down a lonesome lane.
(Pre-Chorus)
This old truck’s still runnin’, but it’s fallin’ apart,
Just like me, it’s haulin’ this backroad heart.
(Chorus)
I’ve got a backroad heart, beat-up but true,
Burnin’ like a bonfire, still in love with you.
Through the mud and the miles, I’m holdin’ on tight,
A backroad heart keeps rollin’ through the long, dark night.
(Verse 2)
The radio’s playin’ that song you used to sing,
About a small-town dreamer, chasin’ bigger things.
I pass your mama’s porch light, it’s glowin’ soft and low,
Wish I could turn back time, to nights we used to know.
(Pre-Chorus)
This flannel’s worn thin, but I wear it with pride,
Like this backroad heart, still fightin’ for the ride.
(Chorus)
I’ve got a backroad heart, beat-up but true,
Burnin’ like a bonfire, still in love with you.
Through the mud and the miles, I’m holdin’ on tight,
A backroad heart keeps rollin’ through the long, dark night.
(Bridge)
Every cornfield sunrise, every starlit prayer,
I see your face in the distance, like you’re still right there.
I ain’t the kind to give up, I was raised to stand tall,
This backroad heart’s still beatin’, through the rise and fall.
(Chorus)
I’ve got a backroad heart, beat-up but true,
Burnin’ like a bonfire, still in love with you.
Through the mud and the miles, I’m holdin’ on tight,
A backroad heart keeps rollin’ through the long, dark night.
(Outro)
So I’ll drive these old backroads, till the pain departs,
Carrying the weight of this lonesome, backroad heart.
Yeah, this backroad heart… keeps rollin’ on.
Acoustic sound: Strong, steady acoustic guitar strum and simple, heartfelt vocals that emphasize the story's raw emotion. A gentle pedal steel or subtle fiddle melody weaves in and out, adding a layer of wistful nostalgia.

songs.title: Run From the Reaper
songs.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
The dust kicks up behind me, on this lonesome road,
My boots are worn to nothin’, carryin’ this load.
Got a warrant in my pocket, and a devil on my trail,
Runnin’ from the reaper, but I’m bound to fail.
(Pre-Chorus)
The wind’s howlin’ my name, through the midnight air,
Ghosts of my sins, they’re closin’ in there.
(Chorus)
Run from the reaper, but he’s closin’ in,
Hears my heart a-beatin’, smells my every sin.
Through the canyons and the shadows, I’ll ride till I’m free,
Run from the reaper, but he’s comin’ for me.
(Verse 2)
My old Chevy’s screamin’, tires spittin’ gravel fast,
Chasin’ down redemption, but I’m haunted by the past.
Every milepost mocks me, every star burns cold,
This outlaw’s soul’s too heavy, for the stories I’ve told.
(Pre-Chorus)
The law’s lights are flashin’, in my rearview glow,
But the reaper’s shadow’s darker, and he won’t let go.
(Chorus)
Run from the reaper, but he’s closin’ in,
Hears my heart a-beatin’, smells my every sin.
Through the canyons and the shadows, I’ll ride till I’m free,
Run from the reaper, but he’s comin’ for me.
(Bridge)
I’ve burned too many bridges, left too many scars,
Stole a piece of heaven, under these cruel stars.
But if I keep on runnin’, maybe I’ll outsmart,
That cold hand of fate, tearin’ at my heart.
(Chorus)
Run from the reaper, but he’s closin’ in,
Hears my heart a-beatin’, smells my every sin.
Through the canyons and the shadows, I’ll ride till I’m free,
Run from the reaper, but he’s comin’ for me.
(Outro)
So I’ll race this endless highway, till my engine dies,
With the reaper in my mirror, and fire in my eyes.
One last shot at freedom, one last rebel plea,
Run from the reaper… but he’s comin’ for me.
Yeah, he’s comin’ for me. (Keep on runnin’ free.)
Comin’ for me.
Acoustic sound: A raw, heart-pounding acoustic ballad with an urgent, mid-tempo pulse blends stripped-down vulnerability with fierce intensity, anchored by driving guitar and weathered, urgent vocals that evoke a high-stakes personal journey.
Potential Sound:
A high-octane outlaw country rocker with a driving, mid-to-up-tempo pulse, blending gritty authenticity with cinematic intensity. Anchored by twangy electric guitars and a relentless acoustic strum, the track pulses with a galloping kick drum and a deep, rumbling bassline, evoking a fugitive’s desperate ride. A searing pedal steel wail and occasional banjo plucks add raw country soul, while sparse harmonica stabs heighten the tension. The vocal delivery is weathered and urgent, with gritty, conversational phrasing and subtle backing harmonies that carry a ghostly edge. The tone is rebellious, desperate, and vivid, conjuring a lone outlaw tearing through a desert under a blood-red sky, perfect for a high-stakes Western chase scene, a modern country musical climax, or a road-trip playlist staple.
Why It’s Not a Ballad:
Tempo and Energy: The song now has a faster, driving rhythm, with a galloping beat and urgent guitar riffs that evoke a chase rather than a slow, mournful ballad. The energy is high, pushing the narrative forward like a fugitive on the run. Outlaw Country Core: It retains the genre’s raw storytelling, with vivid imagery (dusty roads, warrants, Chevy trucks) and themes of regret and defiance, but the tempo and instrumentation (electric guitars, kick drum) give it a rocker’s edge, appealing to fans of both classic and modern country. Phrasing: The Bye Bye Birdie-inspired short, rhythmic lines (“Run from the reaper, but he’s closin’ in”) remain, delivered with a conversational, almost frantic cadence that suits the chase narrative and keeps the song catchy. Mainstream Potential: The driving beat, anthemic chorus, and cinematic vibe give it crossover appeal, similar to high-energy country hits that blend outlaw grit with radio-ready hooks. Sound::
Vibe: The song feels like a high-stakes escape, with the reaper as both a literal and metaphorical pursuer. It’s gritty enough for purists but polished enough for a broader audience, with a sound that could fit a modern country festival or a film soundtrack. Performance: Envision this in a smoky roadhouse or a dramatic musical scene, with a rugged singer in a leather jacket, backed by a tight band (electric guitar, banjo, pedal steel, drums). The chorus could ignite a crowd to stomp and sing along, while the bridge offers a moment of raw intensity. Imagery and Themes: The lyrics paint a vivid picture of a fugitive’s life—dusty trails, flashing lights, burning bridges—while hinting at redemption, keeping the emotional depth intact.

songs.title: Under a Southern Sky
songs.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
I was runnin’ on empty, down a two-lane road,
Chasin’ whiskey sunsets, with a heavy load.
Left my dreams in a dive bar, thought I’d lost my way,
Till your smile lit the darkness, like a summer day.
(Pre-Chorus)
This old heart was wanderin’, till you called my name,
Now I’m standin’ in the starlight, and I’ll never be the same.
(Chorus)
I find my heart, find my soul, find you under a southern sky,
Where the pines whisper secrets, and the fireflies fly.
With your hand in mine, I’m alive, I’m whole,
I find my heart, find my soul, under a southern sky.
(Verse 2)
We danced in the moonlight, by a creek’s soft hum,
Barefoot on the red dirt, to a banjo’s strum.
Your laughter’s my compass, through the highs and lows,
You’re the home I never knew, where my restless spirit goes.
(Pre-Chorus)
No more lone-star highways, no more lonesome fights,
You’re my rebel redemption, in the glow of the night.
(Chorus)
I find my heart, find my soul, find you under a southern sky,
Where the pines whisper secrets, and the fireflies fly.
With your hand in mine, I’m alive, I’m whole,
I find my heart, find my soul, under a southern sky.
(Bridge)
We’ve got scars from the battles, we’ve got stories to tell,
From the honky-tonk heartaches to the heavens we fell.
But under these stars, with you by my side,
I’ve found my forever, on this wild, sweet ride.
(Chorus)
I find my heart, find my soul, find you under a southern sky,
Where the pines whisper secrets, and the fireflies fly.
With your hand in mine, I’m alive, I’m whole,
I find my heart, find my soul, under a southern sky.
(Outro)
So let’s chase the horizon, where the dawn breaks wide,
With you, I’m unbroken, on this southern sky ride.
I find my heart, find my soul, forever you and I,
Under a southern sky… under a southern sky.

songs.title: Whispers from the Hemlock Holler
songs.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Creek water whisperin' secrets low,
'Bout the mountain's wisdom, slow and slow.
Hemlock shadows stretchin' long and deep,
Peace in the silence, secrets to keep.
Campfire light a-flickerin' in the night,
Stars above, burnin' ever so bright.
(Chorus)
Old man mountain, he don't speak a word,
But lessons learned, ain't never heard
In no dusty book or preacher's plea,
Just the wind's sigh in the old oak tree.
Truth ain't found in the city's glare,
It's here in the hollers, hangin' in the air.
(Verse 2)
Daddy's anger, a thunderin' storm,
Left scars deeper than any coal mine's form.
Sixteen years, kicked out in the cold,
These Kentucky hollers, stories untold.
Broken arm, achin' bone and all,
But this rusted guitar, answered my call.
(Bridge)
Found solace in the strings, a mournful cry,
Echoin' the pain I couldn't deny.
Each note a whisper, a prayer sent high,
To the mountain's spirit, beneath the sky.
(Chorus)
Old man mountain, he don't speak a word,
But lessons learned, ain't never heard
In no dusty book or preacher's plea,
Just the wind's sigh in the old oak tree.
Truth ain't found in the city's glare,
It's here in the hollers, hangin' in the air.
(Outro)
Yeah, hangin' in the air, like the mountain mist,
A quiet knowin', that can't be missed.
Whispers from the hemlock, soft and low,
The mountain's wisdom, helpin' me grow.
Helpin' me grow...

songs.title: Shadow’s Holler
songs.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
In the hollow where the river bends,
A whisper fights the wind’s old trends.
It claws at the silence, sharp as a knife,
Beggin’ to sing, but it fears the light.
(Pre-Chorus)
The crows keep circlin’, they know my name,
Callin’ me out, but I dodge the flame.
(Chorus)
Shadow’s holler, screamin’ through the pines,
Carries my truth, where the moonlight shines.
It roars in the dark, but it hides from the day,
Shadow’s holler, got too much to say.
(Verse 2)
There’s a fire in the valley, burnin’ deep and low,
Words carved in my bones, that the river knows.
They churn like a current, wild and untamed,
But the spotlight’s a hunter, and I’m the game.
(Pre-Chorus)
Those black wings hover, they won’t let me be,
Urgin’ me loud, but I long to stay free.
(Chorus)
Shadow’s holler, screamin’ through the pines,
Carries my truth, where the moonlight shines.
It roars in the dark, but it hides from the day,
Shadow’s holler, got too much to say.
(Bridge)
I’ve seen the stage’s glow, a siren’s call,
Promisin’ glory, but it takes it all.
Yet the echo in my chest, it won’t stay still,
Like a ghost in the canyon, it’s hauntin’ me still.
(Chorus)
Shadow’s holler, screamin’ through the pines,
Carries my truth, where the moonlight shines.
It roars in the dark, but it hides from the day,
Shadow’s holler, got too much to say.
(Outro)
So I’ll sing to the shadows, where the wild things roam,
Let the river carry my heart back home.
In the quiet of the night, my truth’ll still fly,
Shadow’s holler, under a lonesome sky.
Yeah, shadow’s holler… forever I’ll hide.
Vibe: The song feels like a late-night confession in a pine forest, balancing the songwriter’s hidden truth with a universal yearning for expression. It’s introspective yet anthemic, fitting for both a dive bar and a festival stage. Performance: Picture the rugged artist in a flannel, strumming under stage lights with a band (acoustic, electric, pedal steel, banjo). The chorus invites quiet singalongs, and the bridge offers a raw, spotlight moment. For TikTok or busking, an acoustic version would emphasize the guitar’s twang and the vocals’ grit. Appeal: The allegorical storytelling and emotional depth resonate with country purists, while the melody and production could catch mainstream ears, potentially climbing charts or going viral on social media.
Sounds Like
A mid-tempo outlaw country anthem with a brooding, soulful edge, blending gritty authenticity with mainstream polish for radio and festival appeal. Anchored by a twangy acoustic guitar’s rhythmic strum and a haunting electric guitar riff, the track pulses with a steady kick drum and a deep, rolling bassline. A mournful pedal steel weaves through the verses, while subtle banjo plucks and a distant harmonica wail in the bridge add rural depth. The vocal delivery is raw, emotive, and slightly weathered, with conversational phrasing and soaring harmonies that lift the chorus into an anthemic cry. The tone is introspective, yearning, and allegorical, evoking a lone songwriter wrestling with his truth under a moonlit pine forest, perfect for a modern country playlist, a cinematic drama, or a heartfelt live performance.

Shadow’s holler, under a lonesome sky.
Yeah, shadow’s holler… forever I’ll hide.
Vibe: The song feels like a late-night confession in a pine forest, balancing the songwriter’s hidden truth with a universal yearning for expression. It’s introspective yet anthemic, fitting for both a dive bar and a festival stage. Performance: Picture the rugged artist in a flannel, strumming under stage lights with a band (acoustic, electric, pedal steel, banjo). The chorus invites quiet singalongs, and the bridge offers a raw, spotlight moment. For TikTok or busking, an acoustic version would emphasize the guitar’s twang and the vocals’ grit. Appeal: The allegorical storytelling and emotional depth resonate with country purists, while the melody and production could catch mainstream ears, potentially climbing charts or going viral on social media.
Sounds Like
A mid-tempo outlaw country anthem with a brooding, soulful edge, blending gritty authenticity with mainstream polish for radio and festival appeal. Anchored by a twangy acoustic guitar’s rhythmic strum and a haunting electric guitar riff, the track pulses with a steady kick drum and a deep, rolling bassline. A mournful pedal steel weaves through the verses, while subtle banjo plucks and a distant harmonica wail in the bridge add rural depth. The vocal delivery is raw, emotive, and slightly weathered, with conversational phrasing and soaring harmonies that lift the chorus into an anthemic cry. The tone is introspective, yearning, and allegorical, evoking a lone songwriter wrestling with his truth under a moonlit pine forest, perfect for a modern country playlist, a cinematic drama, or a heartfelt live performance.

songs.title: Canyon’s Cry
songs.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
There’s a storm in the canyon, tearin’ through my bones,
Thunder’s got my secrets, carved in jagged stones.
It howls to break the silence, begs to shake the sky,
But the sun’s a ruthless witness, and I’m scared to fly.
(Pre-Chorus)
The wildfire’s callin’, it won’t let me hide,
Ragin’ for the truth, burnin’ deep inside.
(Chorus)
Canyon’s cry, roarin’ through the night,
Screamin’ all my pain, in a blaze of light.
It’s wild, it’s fierce, gonna lift me high,
Canyon’s cry, born to defy!
(Verse 2)
I’ve danced with desert shadows, where the vultures soar,
Clutchin’ truths too heavy, that I can’t ignore.
They claw to reach the heavens, like a river’s flood,
But the spotlight’s a vulture, circlin’ for my blood.
(Pre-Chorus)
The lightning’s pushin’, it won’t let me stay,
Urgin’ me to holler, chase the dark away.
(Chorus)
Canyon’s cry, roarin’ through the night,
Screamin’ all my pain, in a blaze of light.
It’s wild, it’s fierce, gonna lift me high,
Canyon’s cry, born to defy!
(Bridge)
I’ve seen the valley’s altar, where the brave ones fall,
Heard the siren’s promise, but it steals it all.
Yet this fire in my veins, it’s a rebel’s spark,
Gonna shout my soul, tear the silence apart!
(Chorus)
Canyon’s cry, roarin’ through the night,
Screamin’ all my pain, in a blaze of light.
It’s wild, it’s fierce, gonna lift me high,
Canyon’s cry, born to defy!
(Outro)
So I’ll ride this storm, where the wild winds wail,
Let the canyon carry my truth’s old tale.
With the stars as my witness, I’ll set my pain free,
Canyon’s cry… it’s livin’ in me.
Yeah, canyon’s cry! (Raise it to the sky!)
Livin’ in me.
Vibe: The song feels like a thunderstorm in a desert canyon, with the narrator’s pain transforming into a defiant, uplifting cry. It’s intense enough for outlaw fans but anthemic for mainstream crowds, ideal for a festival climax or a movie’s triumphant moment. Performance: Picture the artist in a leather jacket, commanding a stage with a band (electric guitar, banjo, pedal steel, fiddle). The chorus sparks crowd chants, and the bridge could feature a dramatic guitar solo or vocal wail. For TikTok/busking, an acoustic version would rely on fierce strumming and raw vocals. Appeal: The blend of pain and empowerment, plus the driving energy, could make it a chart-climber or social media hit, resonating with listeners seeking catharsis.
Sounds Like
Full Band/Studio: The polished production amplifies the song’s “raise you up” energy with a full ensemble (electric guitar, pedal steel, banjo, fiddle, drums), making it a radio-ready anthem with outlaw grit, ideal for a festival or soundtrack. Acoustic/Live/Busking: Stripped to a single acoustic guitar, the raw vocals and rhythmic strumming preserve the song’s intensity and pain, perfect for an intimate TikTok live stream or a Nashville street corner, where the allegorical lyrics shine.

songs.title: Tumbleweed Promises
songs.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
I left my heart in a diner, on a napkin stained with wine,
Scribbled sweet nothins’, swore I’d make you mine.
But the road’s a jealous lover, she don’t let me stay,
Now those vows are driftin’, like tumbleweeds away.
(Pre-Chorus)
Every mile I travel, I’m chasin’ what I lost,
Payin’ for my freedom, but damn, what a cost.
(Chorus)
Tumbleweed promises, rollin’ through my mind,
Words I meant to keep, but left ‘em all behind.
They scatter in the wind, where the wild hearts roam,
Tumbleweed promises, never find a home.
(Verse 2)
Your laughter haunts the radio, in the static’s hum,
Singin’ ‘bout forever, but forever never comes.
I pass ghost-town motels, with their busted neon signs,
Wonderin’ if you’re out there, still callin’ me “mine.”
(Pre-Chorus)
This guitar’s my preacher, strummin’ out my truth,
Carvin’ out redemption, from the sins of my youth.
(Chorus)
Tumbleweed promises, rollin’ through my mind,
Words I meant to keep, but left ‘em all behind.
They scatter in the wind, where the wild hearts roam,
Tumbleweed promises, never find a home.
(Bridge)
I’ve loved in smoky barrooms, I’ve knelt in desert rain,
Swore I’d be your shelter, but I brought you pain.
Yet somewhere in this dust, there’s a spark that won’t fade,
A tumbleweed promise, that I’ll keep someday.
(Chorus)
Tumbleweed promises, rollin’ through my mind,
Words I meant to keep, but left ‘em all behind.
They scatter in the wind, where the wild hearts roam,
Tumbleweed promises, never find a home.
(Outro)
So I’ll ride these endless highways, with a bottle and a song,
Hopin’ you’re still waitin’, though I’ve been gone too long.
Till I find my way back, or the stars call me on,
Tumbleweed promises… keep rollin’ along.
Yeah, keep rollin’ along. (Tumbleweed dreams.)
Rollin’ along.
Vibe: The song feels like a late-night drive through a desert, with the narrator grappling with his transient life and lingering hope. It’s less intense than "Reaper" but equally compelling, with a balance of grit and melody. Performance: Picture the same artist performing this in a dimly lit roadhouse or on a festival stage, strumming a worn guitar with a band (acoustic, electric, pedal steel, harmonica). The chorus invites quiet singalongs, and the bridge could feature a spotlight on the singer’s raw delivery. Imagery and Themes: Lyrics evoke rural, transient life (diners, highways, tumbleweeds) while touching on universal emotions (love, regret, hope), making it relatable yet authentically country.
Sounds Like
A soulful, mid-tempo outlaw country anthem with a reflective, road-worn vibe, blending gritty authenticity with radio-friendly hooks.

songs.title: Church of Country (Alex Solo Version)
songs.lyrics:
Verse 1
I hit the stage on red dirt, where the heartland’s callin’ me,
From dive bar smoke to stadiums, this is where I’m free.
Hank’s ghost in my guitar, Dolly’s shine in my soul,
Country’s fire in my bones, it’s the only life I know.
Pre-Chorus
Steel guitars are my pulpit, banjo’s my battle cry,
Every scar’s a song I sing, reachin’ for the sky.
Chorus
This is the Church of Country, where the faithful raise a spark,
Johnny’s growl, Shania’s strut, lightin’ up the dark.
Sing for Patsy, for Stapleton, let the fiddle break the chains,
Country’s pulse is beatin’ loud, runnin’ wild in our veins!
Verse 2
I’m singin’ Loretta’s truth, Willie’s ramblin’ road,
George Jones’ whiskey heartache, carryin’ the load.
From Waylon’s outlaw thunder to Miranda’s rebel flame,
Every note’s my hallelujah, country’s my true name.
Pre-Chorus
Boots stomp the rhythm, my voice’ll shake the ground,
In this Church of Country, salvation’s what I’ve found.
Chorus
This is the Church of Country, where the faithful raise a spark,
Johnny’s growl, Shania’s strut, lightin’ up the dark.
Sing for Patsy, for Stapleton, let the fiddle break the chains,
Country’s pulse is beatin’ loud, runnin’ wild in our veins!
Bridge
It’s a honky-tonk redemption, where the broken find their fight,
Cash’s truth, Kacey’s grace, guidin’ me through the night.
From backroad hymns to neon dreams, I’ll carry on the sound,
Country’s heart is mine to hold, forever glory-bound!
Final Chorus
This is the Church of Country, where the roots will never fade,
Loretta’s coal dust soul, Alan’s river escapade.
Raise a glass for every dreamer, let the banjo’s fire roar,
Country’s callin’ me to sing, now and evermore!
Outro
*(Fiddle tears the roof off, steel guitar screams)*
Church of Country, hear my voice, let the whole world know,
This is my salvation, where my rebel heart’ll go!
*(Pyro pops, crowd roars)*
Hallelujah, country soul, Alex takes the show!

songs.title: Workin for a living
songs.lyrics:
Verse 1
Dawn breaks hard, boots hit the ground,
Sweat’s my pay where the work is found.
No silver spoon, just a will to fight,
Pushin’ through the long days into the night.
Pre-Chorus
Blisters on my hands, fire in my chest,
Every drop of sweat’s a step toward the best.
Chorus
Workin’ for a livin’, sunup till the stars burn bright,
Rough hands, tired bones, holdin’ on with all my might.
Ain’t got much, but I got heart, a spark that won’t let go,
Workin’ for a livin’, buildin’ dreams from the ground below.
Verse 2
Fields of dust, factory’s hum,
Haulin’ loads till my body’s numb.
Every ache’s a badge, every scar’s a sign,
I’m carvin’ out a life that’s proud and mine.
Pre-Chorus
No shortcut’s callin’, no easy way,
Just the grind that shapes me, day by day.
Chorus
Workin’ for a livin’, sunup till the stars burn bright,
Rough hands, tired bones, holdin’ on with all my might.
Ain’t got much, but I got heart, a spark that won’t let go,
Workin’ for a livin’, buildin’ dreams from the ground below.
Bridge
Round the fire’s glow, we share the load,
Laughin’ through the hurt, on this long road.
For the ones who toil, for the ones who strive,
This song’s for the workers keepin’ hope alive.
Chorus
Workin’ for a livin’, sunup till the stars burn bright,
Rough hands, tired bones, holdin’ on with all my might.
Ain’t got much, but I got heart, a spark that won’t let go,
Workin’ for a livin’, buildin’ dreams from the ground below.
Outro
(Fiddle kicks, steady strum)
Workin’ for a livin’, that’s my truth, my fight,
From the break of dawn to the end of night.
